name: STG-44
description: widely considered to be one of the first assault rifles, the STG-44 was produced in germany during the second world war and fires the proprietary 7.92 x 33 kurtz and has an effective range of 600 meters. This appears to be an authentic nazi STG-44.
//: lower price for this one... It's a really only a collectors piece and given it fires an *extremely proprietary round* It's basically useless to the average survivor

name: STG-44
description: widely considered to be one of the first assault rifles, the STG-44 was produced in germany during the second world war and fires the proprietary 7.92 x 33 kurtz and has an effective range of 600 meters. This however is a reproduction rifle built to the original specifications.
//: lower price for this one... It's a really only a collectors piece and given it fires an *extremely proprietary round* It's basically useless to the average survivor

name: STG-44 (SBR)
description: widely considered to be one of the first assault rifles, the STG-44 was produced in germany during the second world war and originally fired a proprietary 7.92x33 kurtz round. This however is a reproduction rifle built to the original specifications. it's been converted into an SBR.

name: STG-44 (pistol)
description: widely considered to be one of the first assault rifles, the STG-44 was produced in germany during the second world war and originally fired a proprietary 7.92x33 kurtz round. This however is a reproduction rifle built to the original specifications. The stock has been cut off and barrel sawed down to make for a very compact firearm
//: higher price for this one... It's a newer production and is chambered in a more common round

name: STG-44 (full-auto)
description: widely considered to be one of the first assault rifles, the STG-44 was produced in germany during the second world war and fires the proprietary 7.92 x 33 kurtz and has an effective range of 600 meters. This however is a reproduction rifle built to the original specifications. The lower receiver has been replaced with an original lower receiver.
//: lower price for this one... It's a really only a collectors piece and given it fires an *extremely proprietary round* It's basically useless to the average survivor

name: STG-44 (SBR full-auto)
description: widely considered to be one of the first assault rifles, the STG-44 was produced in germany during the second world war and originally fired a proprietary 7.92x33 kurtz round. This however is a reproduction rifle built to the original specifications. it's been converted into an SBR and the lower receiver has been replaced with an original lower receiver

name: STG-44 (pistol full-auto)
description: widely considered to be one of the first assault rifles, the STG-44 was produced in germany during the second world war and originally fired a proprietary 7.92x33 kurtz round. This however is a reproduction rifle built to the original specifications. The stock has been cut off and barrel sawed down to make for a very compact firearm. The lower receiver has also been replaced with an original lower receiver
//: higher price for this one... It's a newer production and is chambered in a more common round
